metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12421 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When performing add-on updates, certificate chains terminating in non-built-in-roots were rejected (even if they were legitimately added by an administrator.) This could have caused add-ons to become out-of-date silently without notification to the user. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.10, Firefox < 78, and Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine
